event.title: 18 July 1995, the previously dormant Soufrière Hills volcano, in the southern part of the island, became

data.event: On 18 July 1995, the previously dormant Soufrière Hills volcano, in the southern part of the island, became active.

The volcanic activity continues, mostly affecting the vicinity of Plymouth, including its docking facilities, and the eastern side of the island around the former W. H. Bramble Airport, the remnants of which were buried by flows from volcanic activity on 11 February 2010.
Relatively quiet since early 2010, the volcano continues to be closely monitored by the Montserrat Volcano Observatory.
